column4: hi guys, i was wondering if one can install ubuntu 12.04 on a macbook air 2008 ? i only can find 8.04 ubuntu for that version of the air. thanks
what version are you talking about?
this is te one im looking at http://www.ebay.de/itm/MacBook-Air-13-1-6-Core2Duo-2-GB-120-GB-SSD-A1304-MB543D-A-viel-Zubehor-/120964478785?pt=Apple_Systeme&hash=item1c2a0b7741
so it woudl depend if i bid on it or not depending ont he possibility to install latest ubuntu on it
what version of ubuntu are you talking about when you say you found an 8.04 for it
oh i was just googling around about ubuntu n macbook air and i only found 8.04
well i found this https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MacBookAir where they suggest 8.04... and thats sort of too old for me...
macbooks are intel macs you should be able to use the amd64 and i386 versions of ubuntu.  Thus why I am confused that you found a version of 8.04 for it
yes im confused about it myself as well, thats why i was asking around here
i mean i know i can put gentoo on it and it will work fine, but for certain programs i woudl need ubuntu
so now im wondering if i can isntall teh latest ubuntu on a macbook air 2008 (core 2 duo)
those ubuntu pages are so confusing lol =/
there isn't a 12.04 page for 4,1 because no one bothered to create one, but it should work
